717694f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of 99th Street. The Glenham Apartment House, in the centre, will be demolished between 1930 and 1934, and replaced by a one-story theatre. The one-story corner building will be replaced about the same time by the twenty-story Trafalgar Tower Apartments.
July 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing also the south side of 99th Street from Broadway to Amsterdam Avenue, with St. Michael's Protestant Episcopal Church in the background.
July 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

717693f-a.text:
2628 Broadway, east side, between 99th and 100th Streets.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 322.
Neg W a1S
